text: The Sword of Solkan is an agent of the Knights of Purity, nobody knows his true identity - but all fear his blessed sword and determiniation to eradicate evil
Nicknamed "the strutting cock", he has a hand in the illegal but very profitable "body trade", the traffic in living beings for sale as slaves or even sacrifices.
Pieter de Groot, universally known as "Big Piet" , is a bear of a man from Suiddock. He is skilled in both swordplay and calculus. He is Jaan's personal guard and cargo protector.

Reputedly the richest man in the world. He counts among his personal friends the Tsar of Kislev, the King of Bretonnia, the Sultan of Araby and even Emperor Karl Franz and the Electors. Why? Because they all owe him gold.

The proud Halberdier regiment known as the Golden Pinions are veterans of a dozen border wars against the mercenaries, militias, and bandit gangs that hover around Marienburgâ€™s wealth like flies around a corpse.
Van Klumpf's Buccaneers, also known as The Murderers out of Marienburg are a notorious mercenary regiment. Their reputation has increased greatly over the years, but so has their fee.

Simon Goudenkruin is the Arch-Priest of the Cult of Haeyndrik, the minor god of wealth, power and influence. For a large fee he will lend any men, elf or dwarf financial advice. No guarantees, however.
The Baggage-Train are the treasure bearers of the Merchant Guild, responsible for transporting riches from shops to banks.
The Van de Kuypers are so paranoid when it comes to their wealth, they keep it in their sight no matter what. Protected by soldiers of the Golden Pinions at all times.
Organised rabble from the docks in Suiddock. The ones that look healthy enough are picked up by ships looking to replenish crew before their voyage.
Handgunners a board Imperial Vessels require a steady aim. Boarding troops rely on their skill to whittle the enemy down with rifle fire before attacking.
Veteran Privateers based out of Marienburg. These men have experience sailing the high seas and offer their services for any who can pay their considerable fee.
Tough men with longstanding employment with the Merchant Guild. They guard precious cargo both in Marienburg's warehouses and on board of Merchant Vessels.
A powerful mercenary group sworn to the shadowy Merchant Lords of Marienburg, though it is doubtful that anyone except Edvard Van Der Kraal could keep them in check.
Goedendagers are always first to greet the enemy.
Mounted militia who play a vital role in battle and in keeping the pace.
Mounted militia trained in the art of horse archery who play a vital role in battle and in keeping the pace.
Culverins, with their light construction, make up for their lack of power with good rate of fire and maneuverability.
Those who witness their charge see no mortal creatures, but great elementals of wave and water.
The Strompoort Gate is a massive defensive structure vital for Marienburg's defenses, it houses the Strompoort Ordnance mortars. Slow, cumbersome yet unforgiving.
The River Watch is charged with tax collection and with enforcing Port Law - the body of law that governs ship traffic and any crimes that are committed on the water.
Among the most feared of the River Watch are Schilder's Toll Collectors. Working from the Empiric town of Schildersheim, they pester river traders with improvised laws and tolls.
These riders, and their steeds, are the descendants of the griffon riders of the Imperial Second Fleet. While a dwindling breed, they are incredibly useful when flying in support of the City's navy.

While on his first trading trip around the South Lands to Nippon and Cathay, Egmond was converted and is now a secret but enthusiastic worshipper of Lord Tsien-Tsin, known in the Old World as Tzeentch.

The Defenders of the Capital are the officious Knightly Order of Haeyndrik, started as caravan guardians centuries ago yet now a elite unit only assigned to protect the most delicate interests of the Cult.

Katja de Teuling founded the Defenders of the Capital many years ago, how she professionalised caravan protection proofed a catalyst for trade profit. Now she is recognized as a Saint to the Cult.
Paixhan's are devastating naval guns used to fire explose rounds. These are stripped from the deck of the Marienburger flagship the Zegepraal and expert at demolishing large enemy units.
The Black Caps are Marienburg's Night Watch, fanatical at best, corrupt at worst - they are hard to keep in check, often serving the agenda of those willing to pay them slightly more.
Uncommon for a Dwarf, Guzunda Wallrattler knows every inch of the Wasteland's Swamp, guiding anyone willing to pay him in ale through the many dangers the swamp provides.
The Red Talons are a fearless mercenary regiment from Tilea, hired to maintain order on Rijker's Isle whilst also defending Marienburg from foreign invaders.
The Merchant Lords of Marienburg are as sharp as they are extrovert. Indulging themselves in finery and duelling all the same.
The Consort of Shadows runs networks, syndicates and slave trafficking ring - all for her Master's Bidding
These men pledged themselves to eradicate all that is impure, cleansing them in the name of Solkan.
Lisette Leerer is a enforcer and intellegence officer for the Thieves Guild, she is as nimble as she is deadly.
Captain Daefvid Maecross is a flamboyant, extrovert seafaring Elf with immense skill when it comes to traversing even the most traitorous seas.
The Lord of Shadows, master of the underground, Mundvard the Cruel is as ferocious as he is cunning.
Arkat Fooger's personal guard, as his increasing wealth has found him with a larger pool of potential threats, he has surrounded himself with his scournful brethren.
Lord Harbourmaster of Marienburg's Port and commander of the elite black guard, Escottus is a feared and renowned figure amongst Wasteland society.
These men wade into battle with conventional weapons, but can also call powerful magical forces to decimate their enemies.
